paper_abstract: Design of 3-Dimensional micromachined inductors on high-(10 K Omega . cm) and low-resistivity (10 Omega . cm) Si substrate fabricated using stress metal technology we have developed [ 1, 2] is presented. Using high frequency electromagnetic simulation of 3-Dimensional inductors performed by Ansoft HFSS(R), we have investigated the effects of number of turns, effective radius, metal line width, and different substrates on the quality factor, Q and self-resonant frequency, f(sr) of these inductors. We also have compared the simulated results with the measurement results of 3-D inductors fabricated using this technology.
paper_title: Design of high-Q 3-D integrated inductors for high frequency applications
